note: 72: This superioritas-thesis was in the last resort based on the idea of majoritas (=majestas): accordingly, the pope—and mut. mut. also the king— stood ‘higher’ which in turn yielded the proper concept of the ‘sub/ ject’ (the Unter/tan) whose duty was obedience to the ‘superior’ (‘Oingkeit’). It was therefore perfectly correct when the relevant papal decretals dealing with the relative position of pope and emperor were in the official canon law books under the title: ‘De majoritate et obedientia’.
